intro: Allophyton evolutum, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a unique plant species characterized by its intricate, spiral-shaped fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant exhibits a climbing habit, using its rhizomes to anchor itself to trees or other structures. Its leaves are bi-lobed and have a distinctive, curling pattern that aids in light absorption. Allophyton evolutum thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil for optimal growth.
